alumniOf.name:
NY. He served in the U.S. Air Force from 2000-2007. He is a veteran of Operation Enduring Freedom and received the Joint Service Achievement Medal for his work as a Spanish linguist for the Defense Intelligence Agency in 2005. William graduated from Campbell University in 2007 with a degree in computer science. He earned his J.D. in 2011 from the North Carolina Central University School of Law. His practice areas include immigration law and criminal defense cases. He is licensed and in good standing with the State Bar of North Carolina and a member of the American Immigration Lawyer Association (AILA.) He is a proud member of the Charlotte community and provides compassionate counsel for all his clients.

itemListElement.name: Winston salem nc workers comp lawyers

content.h1: Winston-Salem, NC Winston-Salem, NC Workers’ Comp Lawyers
content.heroSection:
Winston-Salem, NC Winston-Salem, NC Workers’ Comp Lawyers

If you are injured in a workplace accident, you are entitled to workers’ compensation. Frustratingly, however, there are barriers in place that might prevent you from getting the payment you deserve. Having to fight for damages on top of recovering from a debilitating injury is something no one should have to deal with! This is why our Winston-Salem workers’ comp lawyers are determined to help you if you have been put in this stressful position.

At Vasquez Law Firm, we have over 40 years of combined experience ensuring our clients get the payment they are owed for workplace negligence. Employers and insurance companies concerned about their bottom line might try to take advantage of you, but you have legal recourse! Reach out to schedule a free initial consultation and we will begin the process of challenging their attempts to undermine what you deserve.

Understanding Workplace Injuries

Workplace injuries are more common than you might expect. A lot of people imagine that workers’ comp is only relevant to places that do construction or factories or places that otherwise work with heavy equipment. While these types of jobs are more likely to incur workplace injuries, the truth is that accidents can happen anywhere and any workplace can be negligent! 

To better understand how workplace injuries occur, here are some of the more common ones we have seen in our practice:

  • Overexertion and heavy lifting: In jobs that require a lot of manual labor, trying to lift heavy objects that are over your weight limit or lifting them incorrectly can result in injury. These types of workplace injuries are among the most common!
  • Repetitive motion injuries: Even the simplest repetitive motions can cause strain and eventually lead to permanent injury. Even if you are working at a desk, repeating the same motion too many times can lead to issues like carpal tunnel. Even positioning your wrist incorrectly for long periods of time can have significant health implications over time!
  • Equipment-related injuries: There are many dangers inherent in workplaces that concern heavy machinery. Basic negligence can be a huge risk. Machines can malfunction for many reasons, including improper maintenance, poor design, chemical corrosion, and improper usage, all of which put associated workers in danger. 
  • Construction site injuries: Working at a construction site has many risks, including those associated with equipment-related injuries. If your machinery is defective or improperly maintained, you could be seriously injured. On construction sites, you also have to worry about danger from falls, explosions, and structural collapses.
  • Mental health impairment: If you have an injury covered by workers’ comp, the associated mental stresses that you have undergone also deserve compensation! After being injured, it’s common to experience depression, anxiety, or PTSD, and your workers’ comp claim should address these issues in addition to your injuries.

How Our Winston-Salem Workers’ Comp Lawyers Can Make A Difference

Though legally you are entitled to workers’ comp in the event of a workplace injury, employers and insurance companies might conspire to cheat you. They might find incidental reasons to deny your claim or pay you less than what you are owed, hoping that if you accept their initial payment, you can be refused for any additional payments later on. 

If companies want to choose their bottom line over the wellbeing of your employees, our Winston-Salem workers’ comp lawyers can help fight back. We will protect you from predatory practices while you are vulnerable and pursue the full amount you are owed, taking pressure off you at a time where healing is crucial. 

Vasquez Law Firm Will Seek Just Compensation

At Vasquez Law Firm, we believe in justice. We have 40 years of experience helping clients get the compensation packages that will help them make a full recovery! If you are suffering due to a workplace injury, reach out to schedule a free initial consultation and we will get to know you and your circumstances. 

Frequently Asked Questions

Will a medical report be helpful in my workers’ comp claim?

Absolutely. Having professional notes and diagnostics can only help support your claim, and it’s best that you document these as thoroughly as possible. 

Can I get compensation for an old injury?

Potentially. There are certain time limits when it comes to seeking compensation for an old injury, but our workers’ comp lawyer can help walk you through your options. 

How long do I have to report my accident to my employer?

Report your injury to your employer no later than 30 days.

Practice Areas

  • Winston-Salem, NC Auto Accident Lawyers
  • Winston-Salem, NC Immigration Lawyers
  • Winston-Salem, NC Workers’ Comp Lawyers

mainEntity.name: How long does the immigration process take?

acceptedAnswer.text: Immigration timelines vary greatly depending on your case type. Green card applications can take 8-33 months, while citizenship typically takes 8-12 months. Contact Vasquez Law Firm for a personalized timeline assessment.

mainEntity.name: Do I need an immigration lawyer?

acceptedAnswer.text: While not required, an immigration lawyer significantly improves your chances of success. Immigration law is complex and constantly changing. Our attorneys at Vasquez Law Firm ensure your application is complete and accurate.

mainEntity.name: How much does an immigration lawyer cost in Charlotte?

acceptedAnswer.text: Immigration attorney fees vary by case complexity. Vasquez Law Firm offers competitive rates and payment plans. Call 1-844-YO-PELEO for a free consultation and fee quote.

## Serving Charlotte and Surrounding Areas
Vasquez Law Firm proudly serves clients throughout Charlotte, Mecklenburg County, and the greater North Carolina area. With offices conveniently located in Charlotte, we're here to help with all your legal needs.


## Why Choose Vasquez Law Firm?
- **Experienced Attorneys**: Over 20 years of combined legal experience
- **Bilingual Services**: We speak English and Spanish
- **Free Consultation**: Call 1-844-YO-PELEO today
- **Proven Results**: Hundreds of satisfied clients
- **24/7 Availability**: We're here when you need us
